metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13112 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A PngChunk::parseChunkContent uncontrolled memory allocation in Exiv2 through 0.27.1 allows an attacker to cause a denial of service (crash due to an std::bad_alloc exception) via a crafted PNG image file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13112` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exiv2 - 0.25-3.1ubuntu0.18.04.3
libexiv2-14 - 0.25-3.1ubuntu0.18.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exiv2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.25-3.1ubuntu0.18.04.3').
